Table of Contents Copied! By: Rand Fishkin April 25, 2005 Google Images & Concept Guessing Game Moz News The author's views are entirely their own (excluding the unlikely event of hypnosis) and may not always reflect the views of Moz. Nacho from SEW points to an excellent site that uses Google's image results in Flash to create a guessing game. The object is to determine, as quickly as possible, what the query is that produced the given image results. The game is fast-paced, addivtive, and very revealing. It's a nice way to think about Google's image technology and get a good feel for how well it really works. The game is called - Guess the Google, and it creator, Grant Robinson, has a terrific site of his own where he points to several other interesting projects. Copied! Back to Top
